title: Global Economics Monthly, December 2021
description: We are pleased to share the December 2021 issue of the Global Economics Monthly (GEM), the newsletter of the CSIS Economics Program. This month’s GEM features our latest commentaries, recent and upcoming events, and other updates from the team.

title: Bad Idea: Winning the Gray Zone
description: The next U.S. National Defense Strategy will be about winning the strategic competition with China (and to a lesser extent, Russia).

title: The Kremlin Playbook 3
description: This study aims to expose a new front of Russian malign influence: the instrumentalization of values, traditions, and religious beliefs to exploit or sow divisions among Western societies.

title: Spotlight - Senator Leahy’s Retirement Sad Day for U.S.-Vietnam Relations
description: Senator Patrick Leahy’s announcement on November 16, 2021, that he will not run for reelection was a sad day for U.S.-Vietnam relations. Few people have done as much as Senator Leahy to foster friendly relations between the two nations.

title: Uneven Refugee Protections Across Southeast Asia Put Migrants at Risk
description: Southeast Asian countries have implemented a patchwork of regulations on refugees, responding to crises as they arise. The region’s ad hoc approach to humanitarianism, combined with the international community’s apathy, has marginalized refugees.

title: The Iranian and Houthi War against Saudi Arabia
description: Aided by Iran, the Houthi movement in Yemen is waging an intensifying campaign against civilian infrastructure targets in Saudi Arabia using cruise missiles, ballistic missiles, and explosive-laden drones, according to a new brief by the Transnational Threats Project.
